snippet: Pope Francis’ meeting with Kim Davis cheered conservatives troubled by his words on poverty, the environment and immigration, and dismayed liberals who said it negated much of the good will he had built up on his trip.

byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein reported from New York, and Jim Yardley from Rome. Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome.
byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and JIM YARDLEY

abstract: Confirmation of Pope Francis' highly secret meeting with Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis has placed his visit to United States at center of culture wars over same-sex marriage; meeting has raised questions over its purpose and over views of pope who, while in many ways more liberal than his predecessors, still opposes gay marriage.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Pope Francis’ meeting with Kim Davis cheered conservatives troubled by his words on poverty, the environment and immigration, and dismayed liberals who said it negated much of the good will he had built up on his trip.

headline.print_headline: The Pope, the Clerk and Culture Wars Revisited
headline.main: Pope Francis, the Kentucky Clerk and Culture Wars Revisited
